intro: Antirrhinum calycinum var. rubrum, commonly known as the red-flowered snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its vibrant red tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
